g2.note: G2 scraping requires Selenium + anti-bot bypass

basic_info.note: Full job scraping not implemented - placeholder

competitive_positioning.competitive_moat: Brand recognition and community around the Sails framework.
competitive_positioning.differentiation: Founded by the creators of Sails.js, offering both the framework and professional services.
competitive_advantages: Direct access to the framework's creators
competitive_vulnerabilities: Competition from larger, more diversified development studios

business_model.revenue_model: Services (web, mobile, cloud development) and Support

growth_bottlenecks: Hiring and retaining skilled Sails.js developers
Marketing and sales efforts to reach larger clients

key_risks: Dependence on the continued popularity of Sails.js
Competition from alternative frameworks and development approaches

strengths: Strong brand recognition within the Sails.js community
Potential for recurring revenue through support contracts
concerns: Scalability challenges of a services-based business
comparable_companies: Professional services firms specializing in specific frameworks
Companies offering commercial support for open-source projects

next_steps: Expand service offerings to adjacent technologies to reduce reliance on Sails.js
Develop packaged solutions or products based on Sails.js to improve scalability
expansion_opportunities: Training and certification programs for Sails.js developers
Partnerships with cloud providers or other technology vendors
